lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/duke/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.duke()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* A Duke class that encapsulates the information of Duke
* The entry of the Duke application
* A command class that encapsulates the action of adding a specific task into the task list.
* @param taskToAdd Task instance that needs to be added.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws FileIoException {
* An abstract class the encapsulates the command action.
* Executes the command instructed to Duke.
* @param tasks   Current task list that is stored in Duke.
* @param storage Current storage object that is stored in Duke.
* @param ui      Current ui object that is stored in Duke.
* @throws DukeException Exception will be thrown for unexpected scenarios.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws DukeException;
* A simple method to check whether the current Command is an Exit Command.
* @return True if the command is Exit Command, false otherwise.
* A command class that encapsulates the action of deleting a specific task in the task list.
* @param indexOfTaskToDelete index that specifies the position of the task that needs to be deleted.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws DukeException {
* A command class that encapsulates the action of exiting Duke.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* A FindCommand class that encapsulates the action of find in Duke.
* @param stringToFind the string that needs to be found.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* A command class that encapsulates the action of calling help menu in Duke.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* A command class that encapsulates the action of displaying all tasks in the current task list in Duke.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) {
* A command class that encapsulates the action of mark or unmark a specific task in the task list.
* @param toMark              Indicates whether to mark or unmark the specific task.
* @param indexOfTaskToDelete Indicates the index of the task that needs to be marked or unmarked.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws InvalidIndexException, FileIoException {
* A general Exception class that encapsulates all the unexpected scenarios in Duke.
* An Exception class that encapsulates the situation where user did not indicate date when he/she supposed to.
super("OOPS!!! You have not entered the date for this task.");
* An Exception class that encapsulates the situation where the user did not include the description of a command.
super("OOPS!!! The description of a command cannot be empty.");
* An Exception class that encapsulates the situation where the user did not specific the index of task.
super("OOPS!!!You have not indicate which task you would like to perform action on.");
* An Exception class that encapsulates the situation where a specific file required does not exist.
super("OOPS!!! The saved list had disappeared.");
* A general Exception class that encapsulates the unexpected situation that is related to File operation in Duke.
* An Exception class that encapsulates the situation where the user has given a wrong date format/date format that
* is not supported in current version of Duke.
super("OOPS!!! I could not recognised the date you entered.");
* A general Exception class that encapsulates the unexpected situation that is related to user input.
* An Exception class that encapsulates the situation where the certain syntax is not as desired.
* An Exception class that encapsulates the situation where the user has given a command that Duke does not recognise.
super("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-("
+ "Try HELP to find out the list of commands.");
* An Exception class that encapsulates the situation where the user has given an invalid index to a task.
* A parser class that encapsulates the action of parsing string to desired Object.
* Parses the user input to relevant command.
* @return Command that needs to be executed.
* @throws DukeException throws an exception when there is unexpected input.
public static Command parse(String fullCommand) throws DukeException {
* Parses the string command into index if possible.
* @throws IllegalInputException When user did not include an index.
public static int parseToTaskIndex(String[] fullCommandArray) throws IllegalInputException {
* Parses the string command into AddCommand that adds a Todo_task
* @throws EmptyDescriptionException throws exception when the description of Todo_task is not given.
private static Command parseToAddTodoCommand(String[] fullCommandArray) throws EmptyDescriptionException {
private static Command parseToAddDeadlineCommand(String[] fullCommandArray) throws IllegalInputException {
private static Command parseToAddEventCommand(String[] fullCommandArray) throws IllegalInputException {
* Parses the input String into LocalDate instance
* @param date the date that the user has entered.
* @throws IllegalDateFormatException throws an exception when the input date is not of correct format.
public static LocalDate parseToLocalDateTime(String date) throws IllegalDateFormatException {
private static Command parseToFindCommand(String[] fullCommandArray) throws EmptyDescriptionException {
private static void simpleDescriptionChecking(String[] fullCommandArray) throws EmptyDescriptionException {
* A Storage class that encapsulates the action of saving and loading task list in Duke from a specific storage file.
* Constructs a Storage Object with specifying the current directory as the directory to put the storage file.
* Saves the tasks in the current task list of Duke into the storage file
* @param taskList the current task list in Duke
* @throws FileDoesNotExistException Throws an exception when the storage file does not exist.
public void save(TaskList taskList) throws FileIoException {
* Loads the task list from the storage file when Duke initialised.
* @throws DukeException throws an exception when encountering unexpected behaviours.
* @throws FileIoException throws an exception when encountering error in creating the file
throw new FileIoException("Error creating file: " + path);
* A StorageDecoder class that encapsulates that action of decoding storage file
* Decodes the storage file into a TaskList object
* @param path the place where the storage file is at
* @throws DukeException throws an Exception when encountering unexpected behaviour.
public static TaskList decode(Path path) throws DukeException {
throw new FileIoException("Error reading from file: " + path);
* Decodes a String into a Task object
* @param decodedStringArr decoded string array from the storage file
* @throws DukeException throws an Exception when encountering unexpected behaviour.
public static Task decodeToTask(String[] decodedStringArr) throws DukeException {
throw new IllegalSyntaxException("ERROR!!! Cannot recognise the type of task being saved.");
* A StorageEncoder class that encapsulates the action of encoding the TaskList object into the storage file.
* Encodes the given TaskList Object into a List of String.
* A Deadline class that encapsulates the information of deadline task.
* @param by          the deadline of the task.
* @param by          the deadline of the task
* @param status      indicate whether the task has been done.
public Deadline(String description, LocalDate by, String status) {
* An Event class that encapsulates the information of an Event task.
* @param description the description of the Event task.
* @param at          the date of the event.
* @param description the description of the Event task.
* @param at          the date of the event.
* @param status      to indicate whether the task has been done
public Event(String description, LocalDate at, String status) {
* An abstract Task class that encapsulates the information of a task in Duke.
* Constructor for the child class to construct a Task Object.
* @param description the description of the task.
* Gets the type of the task.
* Gets the date of the task.
* Gets the status icon of the task.
* @return "X" if the task is being done, " " otherwise.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Checks if the task is done.
* @return true if the task has been done.
* Gets the description of the task.
* A TaskList class that encapsulates the information and actions that are performed by the task list.
* Constructs a TaskList Object from another TaskList.
* Gets the current list of all the tasks.
* @return the list of all the tasks
* Gets the number of tasks in the list.
* Marks a task in the task list as done.
* @param index the position of the task in the list
* Marks a task in the task list as not done
* @param index the position of the task in the list
* Deletes a task in the task list
* @param index the position of the task that needs to be deleted
* Adds a task to the current task list
* @param task the task that needs to be added.
* Finds all the tasks that contain a specific keyword
* A Todo_class that encapsulates the information of Todo_task.
* @param description the description of the task.
* @param description the description of the task.
* @param status      indicates whether the task has been done.
* An Ui class that encapsulates the ui of Duke.
private final Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
* @return the command entered by the user
System.out.println(dialog("Hello! I'm Duke", "What can I do for you?"));
* Shows the task that is being marked or unmarked
System.out.println(dialog("Nice! I've marked this task as done:", task.toString()));
System.out.println(dialog("Nice! I've marked this task as not done yet:", task.toString()));
* Shows the task that is being deleted
* @param numOfRemainingTasks the number of remaining tasks in the list
public void showDeletedTask(Task task, Integer numOfRemainingTasks) {
String remainder = String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", numOfRemainingTasks);
System.out.println(dialog("Noted. I've removed this task:", task.toString(), remainder));
* Shows the task that is being added.
* @param numOfRemainingTasks the number if tasks in the list
public void showAddTask(Task task, Integer numOfRemainingTasks) {
String remainder = String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list.", numOfRemainingTasks);
System.out.println(dialog("Got it. I've added this task:", task.toString(), remainder));
* Shows the command the Duke support
System.out.println(dialog("The following is the list of commands:",
"LIST   To see the list of current tasks.",
"Mark {any number}    To mark a task as done.",
"Todo {Task description}    To add a TODO task.",
"Deadline {Task description}/{YYYY-MM-DD}    To add a DEADLINE task.",
"Event {Task description}/{YYYY-MM-DD}    To add an EVENT task.",
"Find {keyword} To find the task with keyword.",
"Help    To see the list of commands."));
* Shows all the tasks in the list
strArr[0] = "Here are the tasks in your list:";
* Shows all the tasks that has been found
strArr[0] = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:";
* To wrap the response from Duke in a frame
* @return the wrapped response that is ready to be shown to the user
